instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.820-2915B: What is 820-2915B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915A: What is 820-2915A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A-No detect battery-no water damage.
threads.message:
Hello all !:p
I try to find a solution for these problems:
Magsafe connected (green light ok)--->board boot--->shutdown--->boot and finally acces to OSX--->no battery detected and no batterry indicator lights.(no water damage).
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>K91X_MLB</SIGNAL> BRD file and soft+<SIGNAL>K91F_820</SIGNAL>-<SIGNAL>2915_REVB</SIGNAL> PDF..

I have try to understand few video that addresses this problem, but can't understand everything... I'm french and I hope that you can guide me in this exploration.:rolleyes::rolleyes:

I have check around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> chip for Resistance/smd ceramic page 63 of 101(page Pbus Supply & Battery charger) I just have exchange 2 resistances(<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> because not 10Ω was present after desoldering..)
I have desoldering <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>) check few tracks finally resoldering this chip.I did not find anything wrong.about that. (tell me if I'm wrong;)).
I have somes questions for differents mesures:
Why in place <CAPACITOR>C7056</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7057</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> have 2.55mFarads on tester while components are ok?The same for <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>--->0.000536µF in place and desoldering 0.049µF so I decide to change it for 0.02µF(normaly 0.01µF ±10%, in pdf). /<CAPACITOR>C7000</CAPACITOR> 2.7µF in place and 1,2µFdesold..
I observed a decrease in voltage in pins 7,8,9 of battery connector(J6950)--->3.42V to 0V...??
So I have <RESISTOR>R7039</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7039</CAPACITOR> are missing on my board, and present on the board view (it's not grave if I don't have the good revision of board view or pdf?)
I'm happy to post here.
Thanks in advance for your help.
See you soon.
Lucas
France.

threads.message: Battery indicator doesn't works???? Check pull-up resistors <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>... What voltage do you have on pins 4 and 6 from J6950???

Mesures ( no magsafe connected)
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>= 1.7k‎Ω and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>=1,98k‎Ω (normaly 2k‎Ω ±5% in pdf)
I connected magsafe mac boot , and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is 0Ω on tester!!!!! and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>=2k‎Ω a problem with <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>??????

PINS 4=3.42V and PINS 6=0,76V (constant voltage of <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> is it ok for you????)
If you need picturs or other mesures tell me!!!!!
Thanxs a lot

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A-No detect battery-no water damage.
threads.message:
Measure on diode mode pin 4 and 6 on the battery connector. This is probably a dead SMC.

Stop applying power and measuring things, you will destroy the board!!!

Don't worry about that sensor for now, it is reading a little low. I bet you are using a fake China charger.

Magsafe discon. ....
Mode diode mesure on pin 4 and 6:
pin 4 =1
pin 6 =between 595 and 504.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A-No detect battery-no water damage.
threads.message:
Ordering a new F2117 is not going to help you. It has internal firmware and needs to be taken from a donor board. 
Also this board should not shut down just clicking on things.....I suspect there is a lot more wrong with this board.
